item.description:
Price: Free for dues paying members.

Drive south to Jeanne and Wayne’s "Green Acres" for an evening out in the cornstalks, with the other Beanstalks, on Saturday, May 4, at 7 p.m. If you haven’t seen or heard DJ Dru in action, you’re in for a treat, because this deejay likes partyin’ dancin’ fools. There’s no expense to attend this party if you’re a dues paying Beanstalk member in good standing. Otherwise, bring $5 as a donation for the Robert Austin Scholarship fund.

So, why a "Green Acres Dance"? Our hostess, Jeanne, lived for decades within the confines of Route 128/Interstate 95, loving the city life. Nevertheless, after wedding Wayne and moving OUTSIDE OF I-495, to what seemed like the middle of nowhere (North Attleboro), Jeanne feels more like TV character Lisa Douglas all the time. Now that spring is here, Jeanne needs all you city folks to drown out the sounds of the crickets, the frogs, & other wildlife, at least for one night.

Besides a sizable spread in the backyard (enough room for Oliver Douglas to run his tractor), Jeanne & Wayne have a mega-large rumpus room, which is set aside for dancing, especially Beanstalk dancing.

Feel free to come as a favorite Green Acres character -- Lisa in her flowing negligee ensemble, Oliver in his three-piece suit, or Mr. Drucker in his storekeeper’s apron. Or, just come as you are. Pitchforks, tractors, & pigs will be parked out in the "Back 40."

Your non-Beanstalk guests are welcome. so long as they’re over 21 and so long as you’re accountable for their behavior. You may bring your libations of choice, but if you begin to exhibit porcine behavior, rathern than that of respectable Hootersville folks, Jeanne & Wayne will insist that you spend the night on a couch or other flat surface at their place.

We’ll have party snacks & plenty of non-alcoholic drinks available for you. You’re welcome to contribute your own favorite party food -- try Drucker’s General Store.
item.name: BBTC Spring Dance at Members' Home in N. Attleboro
